intro: Eupatoriastrum angulifolium, commonly known as the angular-leaved eupatoriastrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
